greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of divisors of n which are <= n^(1/2).
comment: a(1) = 1 and a(24) = 24. For each pair of primes p,q such that p < q < p^2, if n = p^3*q, then a(n) = n. There are others as well; e.g. a(40)=40. - _Don Reble_, Aug 02 2002
Row products of the table in A161906. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 08 2013
It appears that numbers such that a(n)=n belong to 3 categories: p^6 (A030516), p^3*q, or p*q*r. - _Michel Marcus_, May 16 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(d = divisors(n)); prod(i=1, #d, if (d[i]^2 <= n, d[i], 1)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 16 2014
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jul 20 2002
